ygData.subject: Re: EQ math
ygData.msgSnippet: It is there if you read carefully.  The minions of the dark gods destroyed the gate on Luclin which caused the moon to shatter.  The feedback also blew up all
ygData.messageBody:
It is there if you read carefully. The minions of the dark gods
destroyed the gate on Luclin which caused the moon to shatter. The
feedback also blew up all gates on Norrath, including the Druid rings
and Pyramids.

Considering the massive number of people killed I doubt a lot of
people would survive to see EQ2. At least that's how Sony sees it!
lol

Tuldayen Grimblade
Warder of Tunare

--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, Melanie <snoopy66@g...> wrote:
> No one knows why Luclin blew up (if I'm remembering right). It's
part
> of the lore of the game we're supposed to discover. The Vah Shir
are
> gone, but we have the Kerrans now.
>
> I've a feeling that another moon will be discovered though,
according
> to what a lot of the NPCs say.
>
> On 4/28/05, Su <suceress@d...> wrote:
> > Oh cool!!
> > I don't know if EQ1 will still be around then though. Plus EQ2
could be considered a parrallel universe.
> > I didn't know Luclin had exploded in EQ2. Did they say the story
behind why? What happened to the poor Vah Shir?
> > I imagine in 25 years the game interfaces will be much more
advanced. Maybe there will be EQ 1.5 or 1.9A or something. :-D
> > luv,
> > -Su
> >
> > ======= At 2005-04-28, 01:44:00 you wrote: =======
> >
